main_definition: Readers are individuals who engage in the activity of reading, especially those who regularly or enthusiastically consume written content.

meanings_and_examples.definition: People who read books and other written materials for leisure
meanings_and_examples.example: Many avid readers enjoy spending their weekends at the local library, immersed in a new novel.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Audience members of literature or journal articles
meanings_and_examples.example: The 'readers' of this academic paper were highly interested and engaged during the conference presentation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Book club participants who read selected books together for discussion
meanings_and_examples.example: Our book club consists of seven passionate readers who meet monthly to discuss their chosen novel.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group or collection of people who have access to and consume written content, such as online articles or blogs.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company's newsletter is designed for its diverse readership, catering to both tech-savvy employees and older staff members.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A measure of the number of people who have accessed a particular written work or digital content
meanings_and_examples.example: The online article's metrics showed that it was read by over 10,000 unique readers within its first week.
